moduslam.data_manager.batch_factory.readers.kaist.measurement_collector module

Module for collecting measurements from the data sources for Kaist Urban Dataset.

moduslam.data_manager.batch_factory.readers.kaist.measurement_collector.get_next_measurement(source: Source) → tuple[Message, CsvDataLocation | BinaryDataLocation | StereoImagesLocation][source]

Gets the next measurement from the data source.

Parameters:

source – Data source.

Returns:

message and location.

Raises:

StopIteration – if the data source has exhausted.

Parameters:

location – Data location.

Returns:

message.

Raises:

TypeError – if the location type is unknown.

moduslam.data_manager.batch_factory.readers.kaist.reader module

Kaist Urban Dataset reader.

class moduslam.data_manager.batch_factory.readers.kaist.reader.KaistReader(regime: TimeLimit | Stream, dataset_params: KaistConfig)[source]

Bases: DataReader

__init__(regime: TimeLimit | Stream, dataset_params: KaistConfig)[source]
Parameters:

  • regime – regime to read the data.

  • dataset_params – dataset parameters.

Raises:

  • FileNotFoundError – if any required file does not exist.

  • NotADirectoryError – if the dataset directory does not exist.

__enter__()[source]

Opens all files for reading and initializes iterators.

__exit__(exc_type: type[BaseException] | None, exc_val: BaseException | None, exc_tb: TracebackType | None)[source]

Closes all opened files.

set_initial_state(sensor: Sensor, timestamp: int) → None[source]

Sets the iterator position for the given sensor and timestamp.

Parameters:

  • sensor – sensor to set the iterator position.

  • timestamp – timestamp to set the iterator position.

Raises:

  • RuntimeError – if the method is called outside the context manager.

  • ItemNotFoundError – if no measurement found for the sensor at the given timestamp.

get_next_element() → Element | None[source]
get_next_element(sensor: Sensor) → Element | None

@overload.

Gets element from a dataset sequentially based on iterator position.

Returns:

element with raw measurement or None if all measurements from a dataset have already been read.

Raises:

RuntimeError – if the method is called outside the context manager.

@overload.

Parameters:

sensor – sensor to get the measurement of.

Returns:

element with raw data or None if all measurements from a dataset have already been read.

Raises:

RuntimeError – if the method is called outside the context manager.

moduslam.data_manager.batch_factory.readers.kaist.utils.create_sequence(file: Path, regime: TimeLimit | Stream, used_sensors: set[str]) → tuple[list[tuple[int, str, int]], dict[str, int]][source]

Create a list of tuples containing the timestamp, sensor name and index.

Parameters:

  • file – csv file path.

  • regime – a TimeLimit or Stream object.

  • used_sensors – a set of sensor names to be used.

Returns:

a list of tuples containing the timestamp, sensor name and index.

sensor_indices: a dictionary of sensor name and index pairs.

Return type:

elements

Creates a list of tuples containing the timestamp, sensor name and index for the TimeLimit regime.

  • used_sensors – a set of sensor names to be used.

  • start – start timestamp.

  • stop – stop timestamp.

a list of tuples containing the timestamp, sensor name and index.
